intro: Sphenosciadium eryngiifolium, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, spiky blue or purple flowers and its pinnately compound leaves that resemble those of the plantain. Native to coastal regions of southern Europe and North Africa, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is often found in maritime environments, where it tolerates salt spray and strong winds. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and coastal landscapes.
